III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4141 Safety belts.
Section The driver and all passengers shall be properly restrained with
Description safety belts while the vehicle is being operated.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 8/13/25, a staff member was involved in an accident while
transporting a youth. The youth was not wearing a seatbelt and
sustained facial lacerations requiring 5 stitches under the chin and
one stitch to the right side of the face. The youth required further
assessment regarding a loose tooth and knee. The incident report
identified only one youth with injuries but there may be more. The
staff member reported that they were not familiar with driving the
type of vehicle that they were.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 8/25/2025 and
reported no further information or concerns.
Assistant Facility Administrator was interviewed via
telephone on 8/22/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker
1. Assistant Facility Administrator reported she did not know if
Youth A was wearing her seatbelt at the time of the car accident.
Assistant Facility Administrator reported staff are trained to ensure
all youth have their seatbelt on. Assistant Facility Administrator
reported Staff 1 received a traffic ticket however did not know
what the citation was for. Assistant Facility Administrator reported
Staff 1 resigned from her employment at the facility. Assistant
Facility Administrator reported Staff 1 was driving the facility 12
passenger van when the accident occurred and a chauffer’s
license is not required to drive the vehicle.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on 8/22/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Youth A reported she was
in a car accident a week and a half ago. Youth A reported her and
Youth B were going to a beauty supply store with Staff 1. Youth A
reported Staff 1 had just started working at the facility and had
never drove any youth at the facility. Youth A reported the only
car available was the large old van. Youth A reported the large
van breaks were not the best as she heard other staff talking
about the van not being in good repair. Youth A reported as they
were pulling out of the driveway Staff 1 was driving very cautious.
2

Youth A reported Youth B and Staff 1 were talking and Staff 1 was
saying the van was really large and she had never drove a vehicle
that large. Youth A reported after leaving the beauty supply store
she rode in the first row of the van and Youth B was in the front
seat. Youth B reported on the way to the store she did not wear
her seatbelt as she got in the van and did not feel she needed to.
Staff 1 did not tell her to put her seatbelt on, and Youth A stated
she did not think Staff 1 knew she did not have her seatbelt on as
Staff 1 did not look back. Youth A reported she also was not
wearing her seatbelt on the way back. Youth A reported youth are
always supposed to wear seatbelts and some staff will make them
wear them and other staff don’t really pay attention. Youth A
reported on the way back Staff 1 went to get gas and she turned
into the gas station and Youth A did not see Staff 1 look both
ways. Youth A reported Staff 1 did not slow down and merged
into the turning lane and just turned without slowing down. Youth
A stated she did not see Staff 1 look at the car that was traveling
toward them in the lane they were turning through to get into the
gas station. Youth A reported the car hit the front area on the
passenger side, in front of the passenger door as they were
turning left into the gas station. Youth A reported she felt Staff 1
did it on purpose as there was oncoming traffic when Staff 1
turned. Youth A reported Staff 1 was not cautious on the drive
back as she seemed more comfortable in the van. Youth A
reported it happened fast. Youth A reported she had blood on her
clothes and was trying to figure out where she was bleeding from.
Youth A reported Staff 1 appeared to be in shock. Youth A
reported the police came. Youth A reported she had a cut on her
chin and outside on her lip that both needed stitches and her knee
is bruised. Youth A reported she has a follow up appointment on
her knee for x-rays as there was something noticed in her original
x-ray that they wanted to follow up on. Youth A reported her
mouth was not closing correctly so they checked to see if she had
a dislocated jaw and she did not.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
8/21/2025 and via telephone on 8/22/2025 in collaboration with
MDHHS Worker 1. Youth B reported she was in a car accident
with Staff 1 and Youth A about a week prior. Youth B reported
Staff 1 no longer works at the facility as Staff 1 quit. Youth B
reported Staff 1 offered to take her and Youth A to the beauty
supply store and on the way back Staff 1 went to pull into the gas
station and they were in a car accident. Youth B reported Staff 1
was going 45 miles an hour and turned as oncoming traffic was
coming and a car going 60 mph t-boned them on the left side of
the van. Youth B reported she was sitting in the passenger seat.
3

Youth B reported Staff 1 turned in front of the car coming at them.
Youth B reported she was wearing her seatbelt however Youth A
was not. Youth B reported Youth A was sitting in the first row of
the van behind the driver and passenger seats. Youth B reported
she did not recall all the details of the accident. Youth B reported
normally youth do not have to wear their seatbelt if they are riding
in the backseat of van. Youth B reported Staff 1 told Youth A she
did not need to wear her seatbelt as it was a short ride and Youth
A was having difficulty getting her seatbelt on. Youth B reported
Staff 1 received a ticket from the police for not having her
chauffer’s license. Youth B reported no other staff at the facility
allow youth to ride in the car without a seatbelt. Youth B reported
all other staff refuse to put the vehicle in drive until all the youth
are in their seatbelts.
Youth C was interviewed via telephone on 8/22/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 2. Youth C reported when
she was at the facility the rule was all youths had to wear their
seatbelt while in the car. Youth C reported staff would not drive
without all youth having their seatbelts on. Youth C reported staff
would check to make sure all the youth in the car have their
seatbelt on by looking at each youth before putting the car in
drive. Youth C reported staff were strict on this rule. Youth C
reported there were new staff starting at the facility who did not
follow the protocol of ensuring youth were buckled in their
seatbelts, however when asked which staff, Youth C reported she
did not know who but just assumed as the staff were new and
learning. Youth C reported she heard Youth A and Youth B were
in a car accident, however, did not know any details regarding the
situation.
Youth D was interviewed via telephone on 8/22/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Youth D reported the
facility has a rule that all youth have to wear their seatbelts while
in the car. Youth D reported staff check to make sure all youth are
wearing their seatbelts prior to driving the vehicle. Youth D
reported she rode in a vehicle once with Staff 1 and Staff 1 made
her wear her seatbelt.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 8/22/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Staff 2 reported all youth
are required to wear a seatbelt while in the car and staff are
required to check to ensure all youth are buckled in their seatbelt
before placing the car in drive. Staff 2 reported he is aware of
Youth A and Youth B being in a car accident with Staff 1,
however, did not know many details other than hearing Youth A
4

was not wearing her seat belt. Staff 2 reported not recalling how
she heard Youth A was not wearing a seatbelt.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 8/22/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Staff 3 reported youth
and staff are required to wear their seat belts while in the vehicle
and staff are trained not to put the car into drive until everyone is
buckled in their seat belt. Staff 3 reported the staff who trained
him at the facility told him youth in the back of the van did not
need to wear seatbelts, however this is not accurate and that staff
is no longer employed at the facility. Staff 3 reported staff have
been trained all youth are to be in seatbelts since that staff left the
facility. Staff 3 reported no direct knowledge regarding the car
accident with Staff 1, Youth A, and Youth B.
Staff 1 was interviewed via teams meeting on 8/28/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Staff 1 reported she had
worked at the facility for just shy of a month. Staff 1 reported she
was in a car accident while working at the facility on 8/13/2025
with Youth A and Youth B. Staff 1 reported she was told to take
Youth A and Youth B to Sally’s Beauty Supplies and to get gas in
the van on the way back. Staff 1 reported on the way back to the
facility she was in the left lane headed north and merged into the
turn lane to turn into the gas station and did not see the car
coming and turned. Staff 1 reported she slowed down to get into
the turn lane and denied being in the right lane and crossing two
lanes to turn into the gas station. Staff 1 reported the facility
policy is for youth to all have their seatbelts on while in the car.
Staff 1 reported Youth A was sitting in the first row of the van
behind the driver and passenger seat and Youth B was in the
passenger seat. Staff 1 reported she reminded Youth A and
Youth B to buckle their seatbelts when they left the facility and
upon leaving Sally Beauty Supply however did not check to
ensure they were both buckled. Staff 1 reported she was never
told, nor did she ever hear youth in the backseat did not need to
wear a seatbelt. Staff 1 reported she did not tell Youth A she did
not have to wear her seatbelt, nor did she see Youth A having any
difficulties getting her seatbelt on. Staff 1 reported this was the
second time she had transported youth at the facility as the first
time was the day prior in the small van and then on 8/13/2025 in
the 12-passenger van. Staff 1 reported she had never driven a
large vehicle like the 12-passenger van and reported she did not
feel comfortable. Staff 1 reported she never told anyone at the
facility she did not feel comfortable driving the large van. Staff 1
reported she received a traffic ticket for failure to yield for the left
turn. Staff 1 reported she has no prior driving violations and has
5

never been in a car accident prior to this incident. Staff 1 reported
she did not cause the accident on purpose and feels horrible
about the situation. Staff 1 reported she initially froze after the
accident and was in shock and then grabbed her phone and called
911 and the facility to report the accident.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on 9/11/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported she was
working the day Staff 1 was involved in a car accident with Youth
A and Youth B. Staff 4 reported she was working with Staff 1 and
Staff 5. Staff 4 reported Staff 5 is a male and cannot transport
youth unless there is a female staff transporting as well so she
and Staff 1 were responsible for transporting youth that day. Staff
4 reported staff who can transport youth typically take turns, so it
is not always the same staff transporting. Staff 4 reported she
transported youth earlier in the day so when it came to taking
Youth A and Youth B to get hair supplies, it was Staff 1’s turn to
transport. Staff 4 reported she asked Staff 1 if she was “ok” to
take Youth A and Youth B to get their hair supplies and Staff 1 told
her she was. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 never told her she did not
feel comfortable driving the van and/or the youth. Staff 4 reported
after the car accident occurred; she heard rumors around the
facility about Staff 1 stating she did not feel comfortable driving.
Staff 4 reported the facility policy is to ensure all youth are
properly buckled in seatbelts prior to the vehicle being put in drive
and that this policy is “pounded” into staff in training. Staff 4
reported all staff she has transported youth with always make sure
youth are properly buckled. Staff 4 reported she had never driven
in the car with Staff 1.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on 9/11/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported he was
working with Staff 1 and Staff 4 on the day Staff 1 was in a car
accident with Youth A and Youth B. Staff 5 reported as a male
staff he is unable to transport youth unless there is also a female
staff with him. Staff 5 reported he informed Staff 1 and Staff 4
they would be responsible for transporting youth on the day of the
accident and they could figure out who was doing what. Staff 5
reported Staff 1 never made any statements or comments that he
was aware of regarding not feeling comfortable transporting youth
or driving the vehicle. Staff 5 reported the facility policy is all
youth need to be properly buckled in their seatbelts prior to the
vehicle moving. Staff 5 reported no knowledge of any staff not
requiring youth to be in their seatbelts other than hearing Staff 1
did not ensure Youth A was buckled in her seatbelt on the day of
the car accident.
6

Documents Reviewed:
• Youth Opportunity New Hope Youth Center Transportation
Policy: All transportation will be provided through the use of
trained personnel who are aware of safety and security
procedures. Youth and staff must wear seatbelts at all times
and youth are never permitted to drive program vehicles.
Youth shall not be attached to any part of the vehicle by any
means other than the proper use of the seatbelt. Staff shall
ensure that youth and transporting staff are wearing seat
belts during transportation.
• Consultant viewed Staff 1’s valid drivers license issued
8/4/2023 through 4/25/2026 and State of Michigan Limited
Driving Record obtained 8/4/2025 which indicated Staff 1
had an operator’s license.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Reported Number 217860265 dated 8/13/2025 for
Youth A: On 8/13/2025 Staff 1 was involved in a vehicular
accident involving the company vehicle with Youth A in the
vehicle. Youth A suffered an injury that required medical
attention. Youth A received five stitches under her chin and
one stitch on the lower right side of her face. X-rays and a
CT were completed and there was a minor concern noted
regarding her left knee that will be addressed with her
primary care physician.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Reported Number 217870266 dated 8/13/2025 for
Youth B: consistent with IR 217860265 regarding the
situation and also included Youth B was medically
assessed due to visible swelling on her forehead, bruising
on her face, wrist, a small abrasion on her left calf, as well
as bruising under the abrasion. Youth B had a CT scan
completed.
• Youth Opportunity Facility Safety and Environment
Checklist completed by Assistant Facility Administrator
dated 7/31/2025 documented the facilities vehicles were
inspected and was found to be in good working order and
operational, received preventative maintenance as
appropriate, seat belts were operational, and
headlights/brake lights/turn signals were all working.
7

• Michigan Department of State Police Incident No 063-
0003537-25 dated 8/13/2025 referenced report UD-10
serial # 320994 for crash report.
• State of Michigan Traffic Crash Report # 320994 dated
8/13/2025: Staff 1 was involved in a car accident with Youth
A and Youth B. Staff 1 turned left from northbound Isabella
Rd. to a private driveway when it struck a vehicle driving
southbound on Isabella Rd.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 had no discipline in her
personnel file. Staff 1 completed training on transportation
of youth and vehicle safety during orientation that was
completed on 8/1/2025.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as Staff 1 did not follow the
facilities internal policy and ensure Youth A was buckled in her
seatbelt.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
The facility was offered technical assistance to retrain staff to
ensure all staff are ensuring all youth in the vehicles are buckled
in their seatbelt.
CONSULTATION:
The facility was offered consultation on addressing staff comfort
level in driving larger vehicles including the 12-passenger van.
Conclusion Violation Established
8

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
